feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 9:02PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Koyukuk River This Week... Heavy rain in the Brooks Range several days ago is causing high water and some flooding on the Upper Koyukuk River. The lower Koyukuk river will rise over the next several days and crest at Huslia on Wednesday or Thursday. Water levels will remain high as Huslia from Wednesday through next weekend.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 8:50PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Chandalar River Through Monday... High water is now moving down the Chandalar River from heavy rain and heavy snowmelt in the Brooks Range several days ago. This high water will move downstream into the Yukon Flats tonight and Monday and could cause water to rise. Water will cover gravel bars and there will be lots of logs and other debris coming down

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 8:50PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Fortymile River Through Monday... The Fortymile River saw very sharp rises in the river Saturday night and Sunday from heavy rain that fell on Saturday. No flooding was reported, but the river got high and covered some gravel bars. There will be lots of logs and other debris coming down the river.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued June 11 at 11:56PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR SHELBY AND NORTHEASTERN BIBB COUNTIES IS CANCELLED... The storms which prompted the warning have moved out of the area. Therefore, the warning has been cancelled. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central and east central Alabama.

entry.summary: ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 7 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures from 31 to 36 degrees will result in frost formation. * WHERE...Langlade, Lincoln, Oneida, Vilas, Florence, and Forest Counties. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 7 AM CDT Monday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Florence; Forest; Langlade; Lincoln; Oneida; Vilas

entry.title: Frost Advisory issued June 11 at 8:43PM CDT until June 12 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 7 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Low temperatures from 34 to 38 degrees will result in frost formation, mainly for low-lying areas inland from Lake Superior. * WHERE...Ashland, Iron and Price Counties. entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 11:32AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Bear River below Pixley Dam affecting Lincoln County. .High-elevation snowmelt, with snowpack remaining above 9,500 feet, continues. However, the lower elevation snowpack feeding the tributaries of the Bear River has largely melted. Therefore, flows

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 11:29AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Green River near La Barge affecting Lincoln and Sublette Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER
